title: How to Play Pig (Card Game)

steps.headline: Before playing, create a deck with only one rank per player.
steps.description: For example, for a 5 player game, you can make the deck out of only 10s, jacks, queens, kings and aces.

steps.headline: Gather the players around in a circle.
steps.description: Choose a person to be the dealer. When you're the dealer, shuffle the deck well and give each player (including yourself) 4 cards each.

steps.headline: Play the game.
steps.description: All players will simultaneously put one of their unwanted cards face down and pass it to the player on their left. Then they will place the face down card from the player on their right in their hand. Since there are no turns in this game (during the passing stage), there is a 4-card limit on how many cards you can have on your hand at any time. If you have a face down card on your right waiting to be picked up, and you already have four cards, you will need to put down one of your cards first before you can pick up that card. You can only discard or pick up one card at a time.

steps.headline: When you get a 4-of-a-kind, you must not say anything and put your finger to your nose.
steps.description: The others must then put the fingers to their noses also. The last player to touch their nose is declared a "Pig" and leaves the game. Since there is one less player in the game, you must remove a rank from the deck before starting the next round.

steps.headline: The dealer status must now be passed on to another player.
Repeat until a winner is declared.
steps.description: The winner is the last person to remain in the game.

steps.headline: This game requires a full deck.
steps.description: The dealer must play shuffle the deck and give 4 cards to each player. The remaining cards will go to a stockpile placed in the center of the circle.

steps.headline: Play the game.
steps.description: The gameplay is slightly different from the previous method. The dealer will draw cards from the stock, and unwanted cards are placed in a separate pile next to the stockpile. The 4-card limit still applies in this version. You also still can't draw, pick up or discard more than one card at a time. The dealer can discard cards and replace them as fast as they like. When the stockpile is empty, the discard pile will be used as the new stockpile.

steps.headline: The objective is the same as without the stockpile.
The person who got 4-of-a-kind first in the last round will become the dealer in this round.
steps.description: This is exclusive to games using the stockpile.

steps.headline: Get a blank sheet of paper, white on both sides.
steps.description: Cut the paper into strips 2.5in (6.3cm) long and 1.5in (3.8cm). Cut as many strips as you can.

steps.headline: Discard the leftover paper, and line up the strips in a row.
steps.description: Write a letter from the word PIG onto each strip like this: P-I-G-P-I-G-P-I-G and so on. Mark each strip on the opposite side with a tiny number so that you don't mix everything up.

steps.headline: Before the game begins, give each player (including yourself) the letters in the word PIG.
steps.description: Turn the letters face down so that the sides with the tiny numbers are showing.

steps.headline: Play the game as normal.
steps.description: When someone is declared Pig, they must turn over a letter. When all three letters are showing, the player leaves the game. The last player in the game wins.

steps.headline: Before the game starts, you must place coins or tokens in the center of the circle, next to discard and stock piles (if used).
steps.description: There should be one less coin/token than the number of players. (if there are 5 players, place 4 coins/tokens)

steps.headline: Play continues as normal.
steps.description: You can use coins/tokens both with or without the deck.

steps.headline: When a player gets 4-of-a-kind, the take a coin/token.
steps.description: Then the other players must also take one coin/token each. Once all the coins/tokens have been taken, the player without one has to leave the game.

text: Method 1: No stockpile Before playing, create a deck with only one rank per player. For example, for a 5 player game, you can make the deck out of only 10s, jacks, queens, kings and aces. Gather the players around in a circle. Choose a person to be the dealer. When you're the dealer, shuffle the deck well and give each player (including yourself) 4 cards each. Play the game. All players will simultaneously put one of their unwanted cards face down and pass it to the player on their left. Then they will place the face down card from the player on their right in their hand. Since there are no turns in this game (during the passing stage), there is a 4-card limit on how many cards you can have on your hand at any time. If you have a face down card on your right waiting to be picked up, and you already have four cards, you will need to put down one of your cards first before you can pick up that card. You can only discard or pick up one card at a time. When you get a 4-of-a-kind, you must not say anything and put your finger to your nose. The others must then put the fingers to their noses also. The last player to touch their nose is declared a "Pig" and leaves the game. Since there is one less player in the game, you must remove a rank from the deck before starting the next round. The dealer status must now be passed on to another player. A new round begins. Repeat until a winner is declared. The winner is the last person to remain in the game. Method 2: With a stockpile This game requires a full deck. The dealer must play shuffle the deck and give 4 cards to each player. The remaining cards will go to a stockpile placed in the center of the circle. Play the game. The gameplay is slightly different from the previous method. The dealer will draw cards from the stock, and unwanted cards are placed in a separate pile next to the stockpile. The 4-card limit still applies in this version. You also still can't draw, pick up or discard more than one card at a time. The dealer can discard cards and replace them as fast as they like. When the stockpile is empty, the discard pile will be used as the new stockpile. The objective is the same as without the stockpile.  The person who got 4-of-a-kind first in the last round will become the dealer in this round. This is exclusive to games using the stockpile. Method 3: Playing an extended game Get a blank sheet of paper, white on both sides. Cut the paper into strips 2.5in (6.3cm) long and 1.5in (3.8cm). Cut as many strips as you can. Discard the leftover paper, and line up the strips in a row. Write a letter from the word PIG onto each strip like this: P-I-G-P-I-G-P-I-G and so on. Mark each strip on the opposite side with a tiny number so that you don't mix everything up. Before the game begins, give each player (including yourself) the letters in the word PIG. Turn the letters face down so that the sides with the tiny numbers are showing. Play the game as normal. When someone is declared Pig, they must turn over a letter. When all three letters are showing, the player leaves the game. The last player in the game wins. Method 4: Playing with coins\/tokens Before the game starts, you must place coins or tokens in the center of the circle, next to discard and stock piles (if used). There should be one less coin/token than the number of players. (if there are 5 players, place 4 coins/tokens) Play continues as normal. You can use coins/tokens both with or without the deck. When a player gets 4-of-a-kind, the take a coin/token. Then the other players must also take one coin/token each. Once all the coins/tokens have been taken, the player without one has to leave the game.
